justification: “We collected the Wechsler Test of Adult Reading from all participants to ensure that age groups were matched on intelligence.”

measured_by: d′ from the Recognition Memory task
justification: “We took a signal detection approach to analyzing memory data, obtaining measures of d' for item memory (i.e., discriminability between old and new stimuli).”
“Age was also associated with both discriminability and response bias in associative memory.”
“Age was associated with associative memory response bias in the social domain (r = -0.25; p < 0.001).”

measured_by: approach/avoid choices in the Decision task
justification: “When participants correctly and confidently recalled the value of the stimulus, they made the financially advantageous choice to approach high-value stimuli and avoid low-value stimuli.”

measured_by: mixed-effects logistic regression coefficients using independent facial ratings (warmth, trustworthiness, etc.)
justification: “Perceived warmth, competence, trustworthiness, attractiveness, and generosity were all associated with an increased likelihood of interacting with the social partner in the Decision phase.”

measured_by: self-reported valence rating (1 = Good, 3 = Bad) after each outcome
justification: “In the Reward phase, participants viewed a screen asking them to rate how they felt about Player A's offer (1 = Good, 2 = Neutral, 3 = Bad).”

measured_by: proportion of face stimuli chosen over schematic in Decision task
justification: “Older adults were more likely to engage with people that were familiar (regardless of the nature of the previous interaction)… older adults were more likely to approach faces more than houses.”
